timeline.message: Change text text-exercise-update button to create instead of generate

timeline.bodyText:
I am wondering if this should be more direct?

You are not registered for "EXAM NAME HERE". Please contact your instructor.
timeline.author: jpbernius
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -44,7 +44,7 @@
             "finishExam": "Finish exam",
             "progress": "Exercise {{ current }} of {{ all }}",
             "progressSmall": "{{ current }}/{{ all }}",
-            "noExam": "Exam could not be loaded. Please contact your instructor.",
+            "noExam": "Exam could not be loaded. It seems you are not registered for the exam. Please contact your instructor.",

replies.bodyText: The problem is that we do not have the exam name as this error appears when student exam is undefined. This is also why I wrote 'it seems that'. This could also be due to the exam not being visible for example
replies.author: anditurdiu

replies.bodyText: Maybe you could include the examId. That should be available. Then there is at least some information :)
replies.author: stefanwaldhauser

replies.bodyText: You have the exam name, it is part of the exam object, that should be available here, because the student was able to click into it (it was loaded before in the courses for dashboard call)
replies.author: krusche

timeline.message: Show Exam Title in error message
Merge branch 'exam-mode/client/improve-error-message' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into exam-mode/client/improve-error-message
Merge branch 'exam-mode/client/improve-error-message' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into exam-mode/client/improve-error-message

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        "noExam": "Die Klausur {{ examTitle }} konnte nicht geladen werden. Es scheint als wärst du nicht für die Klausur angemeldet. Bitte wende dich an deinen Dozenten.",
          
          
            
                        "noExam": "Du bist nicht für die Klausur {{ examTitle }} angemeldet. Bitte wende dich an deinen Dozenten.",
timeline.author: krusche
